section: Provider Representatives shall be dedicated to solely providing the Services to Recipient and shall not provide any such services or resources to Provider or any other customer of Provider.
explanation: This clause restricts the Provider Representatives from offering services or resources to the Provider itself or any other clients, potentially limiting the Provider's operational flexibility and ability to utilize its personnel effectively. This is an in-text contradiction because it constraints the provider with the Provider Representatives but no specific language has been used to ensure that they are being compensated extra to only work for the recipient.

section: Provider shall allow the Recipient to use [ * * * ] at no cost, until December 31, 2021.
explanation: The contract terminates on December 31, 2020 per section 3.1, but here it states that the Recipient can use something at no cost until December 31, 2021, which is one year after the contract ends. If the contract ends in 2020, then this becomes void. This is an in-text contradiction.

section: This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement and shall terminate on December 31, 2020, unless terminated earlier in accordance with Section 3.2.
explanation: This sentence contains structural flaws and does not make sense due to repetition and lack of clarity. 'This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement' is grammatically incorrect and confusing. The phrase 'Agreement' is repeated unnecessarily. The meaning of the sentence is difficult to discern due to these errors.
